isis.stitle: 530 and DT-466/408 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1993) - DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS - DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS PROCEDURES FOR.. - ...COOLANT IN LUBRICATING OIL OR LUBRICATING OIL IN COOLANT.

svcproc.title: ...COOLANT IN LUBRICATING OIL OR LUBRICATING OIL IN COOLANT.

step1.para: Pressure check oil cooler with oil cooler test plate (ZTSE-4376). Refer to engine service manual for pressure check procedure.

item.para: Lube oil cooler bundle - [cracked or loose tubes]

step1.para: If oil cooler is ok perform Pressure (Leakage) Test.
Drain all lube oil and coolant from engine and radiator.
Disconnect the radiator from the engine and cap off all the engine connections (with hose clamps and plugs).
Disconnect the unit's cab heater connections at the engine and cap engine openings.
Disconnect air compressor coolant supply and discharge line, then cap lines at engine.
Remove the valve cover/intake manifold andlube oil pan.

caution.para: DO NOT LOOSEN OR REMOVE ANY INJECTION NOZZLES FROM THE CYLINDER HEAD WHILE THE COOLING SYSTEM IS UNDER PRESSURE.

step1.para: Fill the engine with water and attach an air line connection coupled with a regulator assembly to the water drain in cylinder block.

Pressurize the crankcase cooling system to 30 psi. Pressure must be maintained until leakage location is evident. It may be necessary for the engine to remain pressurized over night to locate porous castings or tiny cracks.
It is essential that all points of leakage identified prior to teardown and repair. NO EXTERNAL OR INTERNAL LEAKAGE IS ALLOWABLE.

step2.para: Cracked or porous cylinder head - top deck, core plug area or blown head gasket.
Lower cylinder sleeve "O" ring area. [Damaged or eroded.]
When the location of the leak is found and repaired clean the contaminated engine with Butyl Cellosolve or Butyl jaysolve (only if coolant leaked into the lube oil) as directed.
